metadata.description: Wonders of the World - Ancient, Modern, Natural, and Notable Monuments

wonders.name: Great Pyramid of Giza
wonders.description: Only surviving ancient wonder. Tallest man-made structure for 3,800 years.

wonders.name: Hanging Gardens of Babylon
wonders.description: Tiered gardens allegedly built for homesick queen. Existence disputed by scholars.

wonders.name: Statue of Zeus at Olympia
wonders.description: 40-foot gold and ivory statue. Destroyed by fire in Constantinople.

wonders.name: Temple of Artemis at Ephesus
wonders.description: Greek temple rebuilt three times. Destroyed by Goths then Christians.

wonders.name: Mausoleum at Halicarnassus
wonders.description: Tomb for Mausolus. Origin of word 'mausoleum'. Destroyed by earthquakes.

wonders.name: Colossus of Rhodes
wonders.description: 108-foot bronze statue of Helios. Destroyed by earthquake after 54 years.

wonders.name: Lighthouse of Alexandria
wonders.description: 450-foot lighthouse, among tallest structures for centuries. Destroyed by earthquakes.

wonders.name: Great Wall of China
wonders.description: 13,171 miles of fortification. Built over 2,000 years by multiple dynasties.

wonders.name: Petra
wonders.description: City carved into rose-red cliffs. Lost to Western world until 1812.

wonders.name: Christ the Redeemer
wonders.description: 98-foot Art Deco statue atop Corcovado mountain.

wonders.name: Machu Picchu
wonders.description: Inca citadel at 7,970 feet. Abandoned during Spanish Conquest, rediscovered 1911.

wonders.name: Chichen Itza
wonders.description: Maya city with El Castillo pyramid. Astronomical alignments during equinoxes.

wonders.name: Colosseum
wonders.description: 50,000-seat amphitheater for gladiatorial contests. Largest ever built.

wonders.name: Taj Mahal
wonders.description: White marble mausoleum for beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal. 20,000 workers, 22 years.

wonders.name: Grand Canyon
wonders.description: 277 miles long, 18 miles wide, over 1 mile deep. 2 billion years of geological history.

wonders.name: Great Barrier Reef
wonders.description: World's largest coral reef system. Visible from space. 2,900 individual reefs.

wonders.name: Victoria Falls
wonders.description: Largest waterfall by volume. 'The Smoke That Thunders' - spray rises 1,300 feet.

wonders.name: Mount Everest
wonders.description: Earth's highest peak at 29,032 feet. First summited 1953 by Hillary and Tenzing.

wonders.name: Northern Lights (Aurora Borealis)
wonders.description: Light display from charged solar particles. Best viewed 65-72Â° latitude.

wonders.name: Amazon Rainforest
wonders.description: Largest rainforest - 2.1 million square miles. 10% of all species on Earth.

wonders.name: Paricutin Volcano
wonders.description: Born in a cornfield in 1943. Only volcano whose birth was witnessed by humans.

wonders.name: Stonehenge
wonders.description: Prehistoric monument. Stones transported 150 miles. Purpose still debated.

wonders.name: Angkor Wat
wonders.description: Largest religious monument ever built. Originally Hindu, now Buddhist.

wonders.name: Parthenon
wonders.description: Temple to Athena. Epitome of Classical Greek architecture.

wonders.name: Hagia Sophia
wonders.description: Cathedral for 1,000 years, mosque for 500, now mosque again. Revolutionary dome.

wonders.name: Forbidden City
wonders.description: Imperial palace for 500 years. 9,999 rooms. Largest palace complex on Earth.

wonders.name: Moai of Easter Island
wonders.description: 887 monolithic statues averaging 13 feet tall. How they moved remains debated.

wonders.name: Alhambra
wonders.description: Moorish palace-fortress. Pinnacle of Islamic art in Europe.

wonders.name: Terracotta Army
wonders.description: 8,000+ life-sized soldiers guarding First Emperor's tomb. Discovered 1974.

wonders.name: Borobudur
wonders.description: World's largest Buddhist temple. 2,672 relief panels, 504 Buddha statues.
